channel.title: Gist on Mahi Garg
channel.description: Recent content in Gist on Mahi Garg

item.title: Find K Closest Elements - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Find K Closest Elements - LeetCode Given a sorted integer array arr, two integers k and x, return the k closest integers to x in the array.

item.title: Intersection of Two Arrays - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Intersection of Two Arrays - LeetCode Given two integer arrays nums1 and nums2, return an array of their intersection. Each element in the result must be unique and you may return the result in any order.

item.title: Contains Duplicate II - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Contains Duplicate II - LeetCode Given an integer array nums and an integer k, return true if there are two distinct indices i and j in the array such that nums[i] == nums[j] and abs(i - j) <= k.

item.title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Minimum Size Subarray Sum - LeetCode Given an array of positive integers nums and a positive integer target, return the minimal length of a subarray whose sum is greater than or equal to target.

item.title: Repeated DNA Sequences - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Repeated DNA Sequences - LeetCode The DNA sequence is composed of a series of nucleotides abbreviated as 'A', 'C', 'G', and 'T'.

item.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters - LeetCode Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.

item.title: Majority Element - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Majority Element - LeetCode Given an array nums of size n, return the majority element. The majority element is the element that appears more than [n / 2] times.

item.title: Longest Substring with At Least K Repeating Characters - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Longest Substring with At Least K Repeating Characters - LeetCode Given a string s and an integer k, return the length of the longest substring of s such that the frequency of each character in this substring is greater than or equal to k.

item.title: Search Insert Position - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Search Insert Position - LeetCode Given a sorted array of distinct integers and a target value, return the index if the target is found.

item.title: Find Peak Element - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Find Peak Element - LeetCode A peak element is an element that is strictly greater than its neighbors. Given a 0-indexed integer array nums, find a peak element, and return its index.

item.title: Search a 2D Matrix - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Search a 2D Matrix - LeetCode You are given an m x n integer matrix matrix with the following two properties:

item.title: Length of Last Word - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Length of Last Word - LeetCode Given a string s consisting of words and spaces, return the length of the last word in the string.

item.title: Roman to Integer - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Roman to Integer - LeetCode Roman numerals are represented by seven different symbols: I, V, X, L, C, D and M.

item.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array || - LeetCode Given an integer array nums sorted in non-decreasing order, remove some duplicates in-place such that each unique element appears at most twice.

item.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock - LeetCode You are given an array prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the ith day.

item.title: Rotate Array - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Rotate Array - LeetCode Given an integer array nums, rotate the array to the right by k steps, where k is non-negative.

item.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array - LeetCode Given an integer array nums sorted in non-decreasing order, remove the duplicates in-place such that each unique element appears only once.

item.title: Remove Element - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Remove Element - LeetCode Given an integer array nums and an integer val, remove all occurrences of val in nums in-place.

item.title: Merge Sorted Array - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Merge Sorted Array - LeetCode You are given two integer arrays nums1 and nums2, sorted in non-decreasing order, and two integers m and n, representing the number of elements in nums1 and nums2 respectively.

item.title: Next Greater Element I - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Next Greater Element I - LeetCode The next greater element of some element x in an array is the first greater element that is to the right of x in the same array.

item.title: Longest Common Prefix - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Longest Common Prefix - LeetCode Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.

item.title: Two Sum - LeetCode : Swift
item.description: Two Sum - LeetCode Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

item.title: Fidget Loader : SwiftUI

item.description: The Lazy Loader is a dynamic and visually engaging iOS component built using SwiftUI, designed to enhance user experience by providing elegant loading animations within any iOS application.

item.title: Bubble Sort : Swift
item.description: Bubble sort is a simple and straightforward sorting algorithm commonly used in computer science. In Swift language, Bubble sort works by repeatedly swapping adjacent elements if they are in the wrong order until the entire list is sorted.

item.title: Carousel View : SwiftUI
item.description: A carousel view is a user interface component commonly used in mobile and web applications to display a collection of items in a horizontally scrolling manner.

item.title: Linked List Implementation: Swift
item.description: A linked list is a data structure in Swift that consists of nodes linked together via pointers or references. Each node contains data and a reference to the next node.

item.title: Remove duplicates from array: Swift
item.description: To remove duplicates from an array in Swift using a dictionary, we can create an empty dictionary and iterate through the array.

item.title: Binary Serach : Swift
item.description: Binary search is an efficient search algorithm used to locate a specific element in a sorted array or list. It works by repeatedly dividing the search space in half until the target element is found.

item.title: Merge 2 sorted Array: Swift
item.description: Merging two sorted Int arrays in Swift means combining them into a single sorted array while preserving the order. With Swift, you can efficiently implement the merging algorithm.

item.title: Merge 2 sorted Linked List: Swift
item.description: Merging two sorted linked lists in Swift is like combining two ordered lists into one, while still maintaining the sorted order.

item.title: Instagram Post : SwiftUI
item.description: Coding an Instagram post in SwiftUI is an engaging project. You can use various components like images, text, and buttons to design a post layout.

item.title: Instagarm Logo : SwiftUI
item.description: Creating the Instagram logo in SwiftUI is an exciting task. Using basic shapes like circles, squares, and colors, you can piece together the iconic camera symbol and colorful gradient background.

item.title: Insertion Sort : Swift
item.description: Insertion sort is a simple sorting algorithm in Swift that builds the final sorted array one element at a time. It iterates through the array, comparing each element with the sorted portion and placing it in the correct position.

item.title: Selection Sort : Swift
item.description: Selection sort is a sorting algorithm in Swift that works by repeatedly finding the minimum element from the unsorted portion of an array and swapping it with the element in the correct position.

item.title: Sort Int Array of 0, 1 and 2 : Swift (Dutch National Flag )
item.description: The Dutch National Flag algorithm is a sorting algorithm that partitions an array into three sections: elements less than a given pivot, elements equal to the pivot, and elements greater than the pivot.

item.title: List: SwiftUI
item.description: In SwiftUI, the List is a powerful tool for creating neat and organized scrolling lists in apps. Imagine it as a virtual scrollable sheet of paper where you can display various items, like names, messages, or to-do tasks.
